Name: HMS Chaplet
Identification: Pennant number: R52 later changed to D52
Fate: Arrived for scrapping at Hughes Bolckow, Blyth on 6 November 1965
Propulsion: Parsons geared turbines, 2 shafts; 2 Admiralty 3-drum type boilers[1]
Armament:
4 X QF 4.5 in (5 in) L/45 guns
4 X 20 mm Oerlikon anti-aircraft weapons
4 X 21 inch (533 mm) torpedoes 
2 X Squid ASW mortars (after 1954)
